column5: Just got off the phone with Transport Canada in Ottawa and found out this info....... Any Licence issued before May 12 2010 has no Expire Date... any issued after this date Expires in 10 years from date of Issue... It is marked on the Registration

Just got off the phone with Transport Canada in Ottawa and found out this info....... Any Licence issued before May 12 2010 has no Expire Date... any issued after this date Expires in 10 years from date of Issue... It is marked on the Registration Well I hate to bust someones bubble,  checked mine, issued 16-02-12 (Feb) and the expiration date is 28-02-2022.

Well I hate to bust someones bubble,  checked mine, issued 16-02-12 (Feb) and the expiration date is 28-02-2022.   FYI, 2012 is after 2010. Hence the 10 year expiration. Now if you had bought your boat 2 years sooner...........................

Well I hate to bust someones bubble,  checked mine, issued 16-02-12 (Feb) and the expiration date is 28-02-2022. You did not bust my bubble my friend... just passing out info that has been hashed on another board and l had to find the truth so l did and passed it on to my friends.... " made you go look though did l not "
Bah, my mistake, even the one before that had an expiry date, maybe I was just a beta tester.
Bah, my mistake, even the one before that had an expiry date, maybe I was just a beta tester. LOL
Don't forget: After you receive your Pleasure Craft Licence, you must use it as follows: There is a $250 fine if you are found operating a vessel without a licence.
Where do you get letters? I don't want to put those stick on ones from CT.
Cabelas has them in their boating section, BPro probably does too.

I found someone in Dundas, Ontario She made 3 inch black vinyl block letters/numbers (stick on) for both sides of my boat. It was $20 total for both sides. Since I was working nearby in Hamilton at the time, I ordered and picked up a few days later on my lunch break.  RE: Registration Expiry I'll have to check my paperwork. Can't remember if I registered after 2010.

Where do you get letters? I don't want to put those stick on ones from CT. you can go to any boat dealer and you can buy them in a pack with different designs that you want with colors that will work on your boat...

Any sign maker will do them for you. They will put the full number on a sheet.  ( no need buying a whole package with letters/numbers you dont need ) Also you can get what letter design you want. You peal one side off. Lay the numbers on the boat. Sweep a plastic puddy knife over the said numbers. Peal off the backing.
i can make them....$10 for any board member that can pick them up.
Magic Marker and be done with it . . . .  FREE
